business.headline: Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

Appointed Chairman of Tata Trusts, Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata Noel Tata has been appointed as the new Chairman of Tata Trusts, effective October 11, following the death of his half-brother Ratan Tata on October 9 at the age of 86.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Mehli Mistry, Noel Tata lead race to become Tata Trusts chairman: ReportNoel Tata is already a trustee in the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust, which together hold a 66% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group.

Rupee falls to all-time low against dollar amid oil price surgeThe rupee weakened to 83.99 per dollar, slightly surpassing its previous all-time low of 83.9850 recorded on September 12, and down from the 83.9675 level seen in the prior trading session.

Garuda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Online guide to check statusGaruda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Investors who have bid for the IPO can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks drag markets; Tata Steel up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 65.89 points to 81,545.52, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 1.35 points to 24,997.10

Gold, silver price today, October 11, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today October 11, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Who will inherit Ratan Tata's legacy in the Tata Group?Ratan Tata, a towering icon of industry and philanthropy who died on Wednesday, leaves behind a significant legacy and an empty chair.

TCS Q2 results: Dividend set at Rs 10 per share. Check key datesTCS Q2 results: The company reported a 5% year-on-year (YoY) rise in net profit, amounting to Rs 11,909 crore, compared to Rs 11,342 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

Ratan Tata was a great human being, very humble: Narayana MurthyIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy paid tribute to late industrialist, Ratan Tata. Murthy lauded Ratan Tata as a 'compassionate human being who transcended financial status and official power.'

Ratan Tata's legacy as humanitarian bigger than as industrialist: Birla Group chiefIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Kumar Mangalam Birla, chairperson of the Aditya Birla Group, reflected on the life and legacy of Ratan Tata.
TCS Q2 Results: IT firm's net profit up 5% YoY to Rs 11,909 crore The company's net profit reached Rs 11,909 crore, up from Rs 11,342 crore in the same period last year.

Ratan Tata's successor at Tata Trusts: Who are the frontrunners?The trusts, particularly the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and Sir Ratan Tata Trust, collectively hold 66% of Tata Sons, making them the company's primary shareholders.
Sensex, Nifty end marginally higher; banking, metal stocks shine The S&P BSE Sensex added 144.31 points to close at 81,611.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 16.50 points to end at 24,998.45.
Ratan Tata family tree: Look at its members from Jamsetji to Noel TataRatan Tata was born on December 28, 1937, and belonged to one of India's most well-known business families.

Kumar Mangalam Birla pays tribute to Ratan Tata: Lost true visionaryKumar Mangalam Birla, the Chairman of the Aditya Birla Group, expressed his sorrow and paid tribute to Ratan Tata, highlighting the long-standing relationship between their families and the impact Ratan Tata had on the nation.

Star Health confirms data breach, clears CISO of wrongdoing amid claimsStar Health Insurance released a statement acknowledging the cyberattack. The company confirmed that it was a victim of a targeted malicious cyberattack, which led to unauthorised access to certain data.
Ratan Tata dies: Who will lead Rs 30 lakh crore Tata Group?Ratan Tata's absence leaves a gap, and the question of succession is more important than ever, given that he had no children of his own

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Nobel Peace Prize for Japanese atomic bomb survivor groupThe 2024 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Nihon Hidankyo, a Japanese organization representing Hiroshima and Nagasaki atomic bomb survivors, for its efforts to promote a nuclear-free world.

Nayab Saini likely to take oath as Haryana Chief Minister on October 15: SourcesBJP's Nayab Singh Saini is likely to take oath as the Haryana Chief Minister on October 15, sources said, days after the BJP secured a stunning hat-trick in the Assembly polls, winning 48 seats in the 90-member House.

CCTV captures theft of Kali crown gifted by PM Modi to Bangladesh templeA crown gifted by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the Jeshoreshwari Kali Temple in Satkhira in Bangladesh, has been stolen. The silver, gold-plated crown, presented during Modi's visit in 2021, was stolen on Thursday afternoon after the temple priest left following worship. CCTV footage captured a man stealing the crown.

Meanwhile, India has expressed its concern over the incident and urged the Bangladesh government to recover the stolen crown and bring the culprits to justice. Police said they are analysing the CCTV footage to identify the suspect.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Akhilesh Yadav vs BJP over JP Narayan Centre and an appeal to Nitish KumarProtests by the Samajwadi Party erupted after Akhilesh Yadav claimed that the BJP installed tin sheets in front of JP Narayan Centre's main gate in Lucknow to prevent him from entering to mark the socialist leader's birth anniversary.

Jigra review: Alia Bhatt's sparkle can't save this dull filmReleased-Fri Oct 11, 2024Alia Bhatt-starrer Jigra has promise, and the lead star shines brightest in the Vasan Bala directorial. However, the storyline leaves us wanting. Read the complete review of the film here.

Arvind Kejriwal's zinger as Donald Trump vows to slash energy costs by halfArvind Kejriwal drew a parallel between his own promise of freebies and a similar pledge made by former US President Donald Trump to make a point about the universal appeal of such subsidised services.

A tale of sugar and milk: How Parsis found a home in IndiaIn the 8th century, a group of Zoroastrians, fleeing persecution in Persia (modern-day Iran), arrived at the coast of Gujarat, seeking refuge. The Indian King of Sanjan allowed the strangers to stay on his land. The migrants promised to blend in, like sugar in milk, which has been the hallmark of their relationship with India.

Delivery man killed after Audi rams his bike in Pune, driver detainedThe accident occurred in Pune when the Audi first hit three people riding an Activa, causing them to fall and sustain minor injuries. Shortly after, the luxury car rammed a biker, a Swiggy delivery agent, who later succumbed to his injuries.
Man arrested for molesting woman on Chennai-bound IndiGo flightA 45-year-old man was arrested for allegedly inappropriately touching a woman passenger while aboard a Chennai-bound IndiGo flight.

Mahadev app kingpin arrested in Dubai, sources say extradition to India soonThe Mahadev app allegedly operated through a network of panel operators across India, facilitating money laundering from illegal betting activities. Chandrakar is also suspected of having links to the D Company.

When PM brought Nano plant to Gujarat after 1 word SMS to Ratan Tata in 2008Then Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi had sent a one word SMS to the then Tata Group Chairman Ratan Tata after the Nano project was withdrawn from West Bengal in 2008.

Japanese actor, voice of Japan's beloved robot cat 'Doraemon,' dies at 90Nobuyo Oyama, the Japanese actor who voiced "Doraemon," the beloved cartoon cat robot, died. Doraemon remains one of the longest-running Japanese anime series, still airing and popular across Asia and beyond.

The Kashmir story is much bigger than BJP's fortunesThe present and future of Kashmir matters more than the fortunes of political parties. That a free-and-fair election was held in Jammu and Kashmir and saw enthusiastic participation by the people is much more significant than the electoral outcome. This is why the process, and not its performance, should enthuse the BJP.

Goddess Kali's crown, gifted by PM, stolen from Bangladesh temple, India reactsThe silver, gold-plated crown was gifted to the goddess Kali at the Jeshoreshwari Temple in Satkhira by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2021 during his visit.
Aurora lights up Leh skies as geomagnetic storm hits EarthSkies in Leh, Ladakh were lit up by a rare aurora borealis due to a strong geomagnetic storm that reached Earth on Thursday.

Bengaluru man threatens woman with acid attack for her choice of clothes, firedA Bengaluru man was sacked for his acid attack threat on a woman, an influencer, after he questioned her choice of clothes in a social media post.

Tesla Cybercab robotaxi revealed, to cost below $30,000Tesla revealed its fully autonomous driverless robotaxi, the Cybercab, on Friday.  Priced below $30,000, the Cybercab does not have a traditional charging port and will rely on wireless charging.

KTR's shoutout to Omar Abdullah on J&K comeback, he respondsPolitical leaders from across party lines congratulated National Conference leader Omar Abdullah after his party won a majority in the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly elections.

Vicky Aur Vidya Ka Woh Wala Video review: Rajkummar-Triptii's film is a yawnfestReleased-Fri Oct 11, 2024Rajkummar Rao and Triptii Dimri's Vicky Aur Vidya Ka Woh Wala Video shows potential, but fails to live up to expectations. The film is a yawnfest, says our review.

Actor Shruti Haasan slams IndiGo over 4-hour delay in Mumbai, airline respondsActor Shruti Haasan recently called out IndiGo after her flight from Mumbai was delayed for four hours 'without Information'. Soon after the actor's post on X, the airline apologised for the inconvenience.

Kisme? Virat Kohli's hilarious reaction to fan's Border Gavaskar Trophy requestVirat Kohli had a hilarious reaction when a fan asked him to set the Border Gavaskar Trophy stage on fire in Australia. Kohli will be a key player for India during the series down under, which will begin in November.

Hezbollah leader escapes assassination as Israeli strikes kill 22 in BeirutSenior Hezbollah official Wafiq Safa narrowly escaped an assassination attempt during Israeli airstrikes on central Beirut, which resulted in the deaths of 22 people and wounded dozens more.

Mallika Sherawat on rift with Emraan Hashmi: All in the pastActor Mallika Sherawat recently opened up about her rift with former co-star Emraan Hashmi and called it a thing of the past. The two had collaborated together on Anurag Basu's Murder.

Kajol pinches Ajay Devgn to put his arm around her, fans say 'just biwi things'Actor Ajay Devgn made a rare appearance at the Durga Puja Pandal today, accompanied by his son Yug. In a viral video, Kajol picked her husband, signaling him to pose for a perfect family portrait.

Shabana Azmi to be honoured with Excellence in Cinema Award at MAMI FestivalVeteran actor Shabana Azmi will receive the Excellence in Cinema Award at the 2024 MAMI Mumbai Film Festival, marking her 50-year contribution to Indian cinema. The festival will also feature a special screening of her acclaimed film Arth, celebrating her influential presence in both parallel and mainstream cinema.

Composer Anirudh Ravichander confirms doing SRK's next filmComposer Anirudh Ravichander, in a recent interview, confirmed his involvement in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film. He also revealed that Ajith Kumar's Vidaa Muyarchi will release for Pongal.

How to get new Siri with Apple Intelligence in India? First look at iOS 18.1 & more featuresApple has released the latest developer Beta for iOS 18.1, showcasing some new features like the new Siri, Writing Tools and more. Watch the video to know more.

Beats Pill speaker review: A stylish and powerful audio companionAt Rs 16,900, the Beats Pill sits in a competitive space where both style and sound quality are key factors. It delivers on both fronts. Read the full review to know more.

Apple reportedly has no plans to launch a smart ring, will focus on health features in Apple WatchEven though smart rings are gaining popularity, Apple has no plans to enter into the market. One of the reasons is that it could overlap with its Apple Watch sales. But how? Read on

iPhone 15 Pro gets a big discount on Vijay SalesVijay Sales is offering the iPhone 15 Pro with a big discount offer, making it the lowest-priced iPhone 15 Pro available in India. The platform is giving a flat discount of Rs 30,410 on the premium smartphone, bringing its price down to Rs 1,04,490.

sports.headline: Are Pakistan mentally weak in Test cricket? Shan Masood respondsPakistan captain Shan Masood was grilled in the post-match press conference after the team's loss in the Multan Test. Masood was asked if his team was mentally weak  in the red-ball format.

Injured Rodri and Dani Carvajal visit Spain camp in crutches, get warm welcomeSpanish footballers Rodri and Dani Carvajal, sidelined by serious injuries, received a heartwarming ovation during their visit to Spain's national team camp before the UEFA Nations League clash against Denmark, underscoring concerns over modern football's packed schedules.

Watch: Tilak Varma, Nitish Kumar Reddy enjoy Hyderabad homecomingThe Indian team touched down in Hyderabad on Thursday, October 10 for the third and final T20I match against Bangladesh. Nitish Kumar Reddy and Tilak Varma welcomed the team to their city for the final clash.

Harry Brook reveals lunchtime chat with Joe Root that led to Multan 300Harry Brook and Joe Root's record-breaking 454-run partnership propelled England to a massive 823 total, securing a commanding innings-and-47-run victory over Pakistan in the Multan Test, further deepening Pakistan's home humiliation.

Watch: Rohit Sharma's hilarious reaction to 1st ball 6 demand in netsRohit Sharma had a hilarious reaction when he was asked if he would start a nets session with a six. Rohit has started his preparations for the upcoming series against New Zealand.

Rafael Nadal's retirement tough news for tennis world: Jannik SinnerJannik Sinner has claimed that the impending retirement of Rafael Nadal is tough news for the tennis world. Nadal will leave the sport at the end of the Davis Cup finals.

Pakistan hurt as a nation: Shan Masood slams bowling unit after Multan lossPakistan captain Shan Masood slammed his bowlers after their loss in Multan Test match. After hitting 556 runs in the first innings, Pakistan lost the match by an innings and 47 runs.

PAK vs ENG: Jack Leach takes a stunning catch to dismiss Shaheen AfridiJack Leach's brilliant caught-and-bowled dismissal of Shaheen Afridi capped a dominant performance as England secured a commanding victory over Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs in the first Test at Multan.

Multan Test: Ollie Pope credits Brook-Root and bowlers for historic winOllie Pope credited Joe Root-Harry Brook and the bowlers for their historic win in the Multan Test on October 11, Friday. England won the match by an innings and 47 runs despite conceding 556 runs upfront.

500-plus runs and still an innings defeat: PAK's historic low in Test cricketPAK vs ENG: Pakistan fell to yet another embarrassing loss in the Multan Test match. Pakistan became the first team in Test cricket who lost by an innings despite scoring 500 runs after batting first in the Test match.

No more unpredictable, Pakistan are becoming predictably poor PAK vs ENG: Shan Masood's Pakistan slumped to a defeat in the opening Test against England and are staring at another defeat in a home series. Pakistan are yet to win a home Test series since February 2021.

Near-empty stands welcome Pakistan in final day of Multan TestEmpty stands welcomed players on the final day of the Multan Test match between Pakistan and England. England dominated Pakistan after the first innings of the match and are on the cusp of victory in the 1st Test.

Erling Haaland teases pregnancy after netting record-goal for NorwayErling Haaland celebrated Norway's 3-0 win over Slovenia with a special baby bump gesture after scoring twice, hinting at fatherhood. His celebration sparked excitement online, overshadowing his record-breaking performance for the national team.

He lacks common sense outside of cricket: Root's hilarious praise for BrookSenior England batter Joe Root heaped praise on Harry Brook for his sensational triple-century in Multan Test. Root hilariously said that for someone who has so little common sense outside of cricket, it was incredible how mature Brook was with the bat in Multan.

Shots of Pietersen, rhythm of Root: Nasser Hussain's heavy praise for Harry BrookNasser Hussain has claimed that Harry Brook has the shots of Kevin Pietersen and the rhythm and hunger of Joe Root after the 25-year-old scored a blazing 317 in the Multan Test on October 10, Thursday.

Thank you Rafael Nadal for teaching the world why it's important to not give upRafael Nadal's tennis career was defined by his warrior spirit, fighting every point as if it were life or death. His dominance on clay courts, particularly at Roland Garros with 14 French Open titles, was unmatched. Nadal's legacy will be remembered not just for his titles, but for his perseverance, humility, and the heart he poured into every match.

D Gukesh clear favourites in World Championship final vs Ding Liren: NakamuraIndia's 18-year-old Grand Master D Gukesh is clear favourite in the World Championship final against Ding Liren, says Hikaru Nakamura. Gukesh has been in sensational form of late and recently guided India to their maiden Chess Olympiad victory.

Lionel Messi's return spoiled as Venezuela hold Argentina, Brazil edge past ChileLionel Messi's return to the Argentina team was spoiled by Venezuela, who held the World Champions to a 1-1 draw on October 10, Thursday. Brazil secured a last-gasp win to edge past Chile.

Tom Latham's plan for New Zealand against India: No fear, take it to themNewly-appointed New Zealand captain Tom Latham wants his side to be fearless and take the game to India during the upcoming Test series, which begins on October 16. The India series will be Latham's first assignment as full-time Test captain.

We gave our soul for George Baldock in England win: Greece's Vangelis PavlidisGreece's hero against England, Vangelis Pavlidis, claimed that the entire team gave their soul for George Baldock in their historic win at Wembley on October 10, Thursday. Pavlidis scored a brace as Greece defeated England 2-1.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
